meanings.definition: A pair of processes on a vertebra that articulates with the vertebra above or below.
meanings.sent1: The zygapophyses of the spine help in connecting one vertebra to another.
meanings.sent2: Doctors study the zygapophyses to understand the structure of the spine.
meanings.sent3: The zygapophyses decided to have a dance party to connect better with each other.
meanings.sent4: The zygapophyses are like bridges between neighboring vertebrae, ensuring smooth movement.
meanings.sent5: Visualize the zygapophyses as tiny hinges that link the vertebrae together.

meanings.definition: The articular processes of a vertebra.
meanings.sent1: During the anatomy class, the teacher explained the function of the zygapophyses.
meanings.sent2: The zygapophyses play a crucial role in the movement of the spine.
meanings.sent3: The zygapophyses threw a party to celebrate their flexibility.
meanings.sent4: The zygapophyses act like joints, allowing the vertebrae to move smoothly.
meanings.sent5: Imagine the zygapophyses as tiny hinges that enable the spine to bend and twist.
